Question_Text: What does the HAVING clause in SQL do?
Option_1: Filters groups based on conditions applied to aggregate functions
Option_3: Sorts the result set in ascending order
Student_Answer: Filters groups based on conditions applied to aggregate functions

Question_Text: When is the HAVING clause used in a SQL query?
What is the purpose of using the HAVING clause?
Option_1: To filter groups based on aggregate conditions
Option_2: To filter individual rows based on conditions
Student_Answer: To filter groups based on aggregate conditions

Question_Text: In which type of query is the HAVING clause commonly used?
What is the syntax for the HAVING clause in SQL?
Can the HAVING clause be used without the GROUP BY clause in SQL?
Option_1: No, it must be used with the GROUP BY clause
Option_2: Yes, it can be used independently
Option_3: It can only be used with the WHERE clause
Option_4: It can only be used with the ORDER BY clause
Student_Answer: No, it must be used with the GROUP BY clause

Question_Text: What happens if the HAVING clause is placed before the GROUP BY clause in a SQL query?
Option_1: It will result in a syntax error
Option_2: It will filter individual rows instead of groups
Option_3: It will have no effect on the query
Option_4: It will change the order of the result set
Student_Answer: It will result in a syntax error

Question_Text: How is the HAVING clause different from the WHERE clause in SQL?
Option_1: HAVING is used with aggregate functions, WHERE is used with individual rows
Option_2: HAVING is used for sorting, WHERE is used for filtering
Option_3: HAVING is used for joins, WHERE is used for subqueries
Option_4: HAVING is used for updates, WHERE is used for deletes
Student_Answer: HAVING is used with aggregate functions, WHERE is used with individual rows

Question_Text: What is the result of applying the HAVING clause to a query with no aggregate functions?
Option_1: It will have no effect on the query
Option_2: It will filter individual rows instead of groups
Option_3: It will result in a syntax error
Option_4: It will change the order of the result set
Student_Answer: It will have no effect on the query

Question_Text: How can the HAVING clause be used to filter groups based on aggregate conditions?
Option_1: By specifying the condition after the GROUP BY clause
Option_2: By specifying the condition after the WHERE clause
Option_3: By specifying the condition after the ORDER BY clause
Option_4: By specifying the condition after the SELECT clause
Student_Answer: By specifying the condition after the GROUP BY clause

Option_1: To filter groups based on aggregate conditions
